dt: {bc}the locus of the center of curvature or the envelope of the normals of a curve

et: borrowed from New Latin {it}ēvolūta{/it} (short for {it}līnea ēvolūta,{/it} literally, "unrolled line"), noun derivative from feminine of Latin {it}ēvolūtus,{/it} past participle of {it}ēvolvere{/it} "to roll out or away, unwind, unroll" {ma}{mat|evolve|}{/ma}
The New Latin term was introduced by Christian {et_link|huygens|Huygens:b} in {it}Horologium oscillatorium{/it} (Paris, 1673), p. 60.
shortdef: the locus of the center of curvature or the envelope of the normals of a curve
